message_1: A container initially contains 100 liters of water. Every minute, 10 liters of water is added to it. Using temporal logic, how long will it take for the container to contain 500 liters of water?
message_2:
To find out how long it will take for the container to contain 500 liters of water, we can set up an equation:

Initial volume + (rate of increase * time) = final volume

100 + (10 * time) = 500

Now, we can solve for time:

10 * time = 500 - 100
10 * time = 400
time = 400 / 10
time = 40 minutes

So, it will take 40 minutes for the container to contain 500 liters of water.
